meanings.definition: A person who is habitually drunk.
meanings.sent1: The village had a few drunkards who could often be seen stumbling around.
meanings.sent2: The bar was filled with drunkards laughing loudly and enjoying themselves.
meanings.sent3: The drunkards at the party were the life of the event, dancing without a care.
meanings.sent4: The alley behind the pub was a gathering place for the drunkards, their laughter echoing in the night.
meanings.sent5: The image of the drunkards swaying in the moonlight was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: A person who frequently becomes drunk.
meanings.sent1: The group of drunkards stumbled out of the bar, their laughter filling the night.
meanings.sent2: The drunkards at the party were always the first ones to hit the dance floor.
meanings.sent3: The drunkards jokingly challenged each other to a drinking contest, much to the amusement of the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The street corner was a familiar spot for the drunkards to gather and share stories.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the drunkards swaying in unison was both comical and concerning.
